title: Ryder Cup 2025 best moments: U.S. in early hole on Day 1
content: Europe leads 3-1 after the early matches on the first day. Can the U.S. mount an afternoon comeback at Bethpage Black?

title: NFL HQ building shooter diagnosed with CTE
content: Shane Tamura, who killed four people and then himself in a July shooting at the NFL HQ building, was posthumously diagnosed with chronic traumatic encephalopathy, according to a statement from the New York City Officer of the Chief Medical Examiner.

title: Irked in Ireland: Rodgers put off by travel plans
content: Aaron Rodgers said if he had had his way, the Steelers would have traveled for Sunday's game in Ireland much earlier in the week.

title: U.S. in big hole despite late point at Ryder Cup
content: Despite a point from Xander Schauffele and Patrick Cantlay in the final foursomes match Friday morning, the U.S. still trails Europe 3-1 entering Friday afternoon's four-ball matches at the Ryder Cup at Bethpage Black.

title: Wilks jabs Baker back for 'cut me in Carolina' take
content: Jets DC Steve Wilks had five days to mull a response to Baker Mayfield's postgame jab, and his reply didn't disappoint. Mayfield had called out Wilks, saying the Bucs' win was personal because "their D-coordinator was the one that cut me in Carolina."

title: No timelines set for 76ers stars Embiid, George
content: There isn't a definitive timeline for 76ers stars Joel Embiid and Paul George to return from their respective knee surgeries, both players said Friday at the team's media day.

title: Panthers captain Barkov undergoing knee surgery
content: Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov could miss the entire regular season after undergoing surgery for a knee injury.

title: Everything left to play for during MLB's final weekend
content: There's still a lot at stake entering the final weekend of the regular season. We have your guide to the last few days of baseball before October.

title: Inside the Gundy-Oklahoma State divorce
content: After 20 years together, Gundy and the Pokes split. It was the culmination of a great run and internal strife.

title: How a road rally in mid-August catapulted the Fever to the WNBA semifinals
content: Down by 19. Sophie Cunningham had just exited with an injury. How the Fever responded turned around their season.

title: From The Big Dumper to ... magic? Why Mariners might have the mojo to finally win it all
content: Seattle has never won a World Series. Or even an American League pennant. Could a little bit of magic change that?

title: 'This season he is better than ever': Haaland is becoming the complete striker for Man City
content: The goals are still flowing for Erling Haaland, but his growth as a leader and an all-around contributor has made him invaluable to Pep Guardiola and Manchester City.

title: Liverpool's Chiesa is 'here to win' and now has the chance to prove it
content: Federico Chiesa has struggled at times after moving to Liverpool, but he has a chance to reignite his career.

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 4: Elic Ayomanor, Chargers D/ST among top options
content: Do injuries have you seeking a late-week pickup? Need a defense to stream? We have options with favorable setups.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Mayfield shines, Skattebo is fantasy's top rookie
content: Does Baker have Philly's number? Will the Giants rookie be a lineup lock going forward? Don't be surprised.

title: Micah Parsons' hobby? Beating Packers teammates at HORSE, pingpong and bowling
content: "We just building relationships," Parsons said of competing with his new teammates ahead of Sunday's return to Dallas.

title: Stanley Cup contender rankings: Who dethrones the Panthers, Oilers?
content: It's been the same Cup Final matchup in consecutive years. Here are the teams that can change that in 2025-26.

title: Ovi breaks another Gretzky record? Bold predictions for every NHL team
content: With opening night approaching on Oct. 7, we take big swings on what will transpire for each team this season.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Fever, Lynx take 1-0 leads in semifinals
content: The 2025 WNBA semifinals are underway, and Phoenix beat Minnesota in OT in an instant classic Tuesday.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can Reyes halt Ulberg's winning streak at UFC Fight Night?
content: Who has the edge at UFC Fight Night from Perth, Australia? MMA analysts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Ranking boxing fights: Fundora-Thurman, Parker-Wardley, more
content: From Sebastian Fundora's title bout, to the junior middleweight debut of "Boots" Ennis, ESPN picks October's best fights.

title: Penn State RBs Nicholas Singleton and Kaytron Allen doing record things
content: Despite scouts placing the pair in the first two days of the NFL draft, they returned for one more year.

title: 'Our tradition to is to be untraditional': Inside the lifecycle of an Oregon uniform
content: Throughout the past two and a half decades, Oregon has pushed the envelope when it comes to uniforms.

title: College football best bets for Week 5: Why UK matches up well with South Carolina
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 5 of the college football season, including what to expect when Kentucky heads to South Carolina.

title: Which major NFL trades look better -- or worse -- in hindsight? Barnwell's fresh takes on 23 recent swaps
content: In March 2022, Seattle traded away Russell Wilson, altering the franchise's path. Let's reevaluate that move, plus 22 others from 2022-23.

title: Ranking every World Cup mascot: From World Cup Willie to Maple, Zayu and Clutch
content: Now that the 2026 World Cup mascots have been revealed, ESPN ranks every competition's mascot from worst to first dating back to 1966.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool look to Bayern's Upamecano
content: Liverpool are lining up a move for Bayern Munich center back Dayot Upamecano. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: OL Lyonnes have spent big to reclaim UWCL title, but will it cause issues?
content: OL Lyonnes have won the UEFA Women's Champions League eight times, but have not won it since 2022. After a summer of spending, how will they jell?

title: Chase Briscoe finally feeling like he belongs among NASCAR elite
content: Chase Briscoe is Cup Series winner, but always felt like he had something to prove. In his first year at Joe Gibbs Racing, he's doing just that.

title: West Virginia, Boise State lead best uniforms from college football Week 5
content: West Virginia will don a look that throws things back all the way to 1965, while Boise State is making waves with incredibly detailed, hand-painted helmets.

title: ByteDance To Get 50% Profit From US TikTok Under Trump Deal
content: TikTok's Chinese parent company will likely get about half of the profit from the platform's US operation even after it sells majority ownership to American investors as part of a deal orchestrated by President Donald Trump.

title: Who Is Avantika Gupta? Teacher At Centre Of Principal-Official Dispute In UP
content: A major controversy erupted in Uttar Pradesh involving a dispute between the headmaster of Nadwa Primary School and the Basic Shiksha Adhikari. At the centre of the storm is Avantika Gupta, a primary school teacher whose name has surfaced

title: AFSPA Extended In Parts Of Manipur, Nagaland, Arunachal Pradesh
content: The Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act was on Friday extended for six months in entire Manipur, except the jurisdiction of 13 police stations, in view of the prevailing law and order situation there.

title: From Protest To Tribute: How Gen-Zubeen Flooded Assam Streets
content: Gen Z or 'Generation Zubeen' emerged as a group that encompassed people of a much wider age group united by their love for the melodies voiced by Mr Garg.

title: Stepfather Gets Life Term For Raping 1-Year-Old Baby In UP
content: A special court on Friday sentenced a man to life imprisonment and imposed a fine of Rs 1 lakh for raping his one-year-old stepdaughter, concluding the trial in 14 days.

title: Over 100 Feared Dead In Gold Mine Collapse In Nigeria
content: At least 100 people are feared dead following the collapse of a gold mining pit in Nigeria's Zamfara State, survivors and residents said on Friday.

title: Video: Netanyahu Addresses Empty Chairs As UN Delegates Walk Out In Protest
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Friday faced a mass walkout during his speech at the United Nations General Assembly in New York.

title: Actor Dulquer Salmaan Approaches High Court, Seeks Release Of Luxury Car
content: The Kerala High Court sought a response from the Customs Preventive Department on a plea by Dulquer Salmaan seeking the release of his vehicle seized by the agency as part of its operation to confiscate luxury cars smuggled into India from Bhutan.

title: Delhi Trains Over 170 Officials To Tackle Dust Pollution Ahead Of Winter
content: As Delhi gears up for the winter pollution season, over 170 officials from 15 government agencies were trained on dust control and sustainable road design during a one-day workshop organised by the Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC)

title: After Deadly Crashes, US Says Boeing Can Resume Certifying Some New Planes
content: US regulators will permit Boeing to certify the airworthiness of some new planes, air safety officials announced Friday, in a sign of authorities' increased confidence in the aviation giant's operations.

title: China's Premier Warns Against 'Cold War Mentality' In Veiled Criticism Of US
content: Chinese Premier Li Qiang warned Friday against a return to a "Cold War mentality" and defended multilateralism and free trade, in a veiled criticism of the United States from the United Nations.

title: India Urges Russia To Release 27 More Indians Recruited By Russian Military
content: India has called upon Russia to release 27 more Indian nationals who were recently recruited into the Russian military.

title: Indian-Origin Doctor Jailed For 168 Months In US For Fraud, Drug Distribution
content: An Indian-origin doctor has been sentenced to 168 months in prison for "orchestrating conspiracies to commit health care fraud, US Department of Justice has said.

title: Delhi's Water Bill Relief Scheme Explained: Who Gets Waiver, How to Apply
content: In a big relief for lakhs of Delhi households reeling under inflated water bills, the Delhi government on Friday announced a 100% waiver on late payment surcharges for domestic consumers and government establishments.

title: As Winter Looms, Pollution Body Takes Steps To Curb Stubble Burning
content: Aiming to eradicate stubble burning in Punjab and Haryana, which is a major cause of pollution in the national capital in winter, the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has launched flying squads to patrol districts that are hotspots.

title: Sonam Wangchuk Arrest Live Updates: Sonam Wangchuk Shifted To Jodhpur Hours After Being Arrested: Sources
content: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk has been shifted to Jodhpur in Rajasthan hours after being arrested under stringent National Security Act, according to sources.

title: Israeli Army 'Take Control' Of Gaza Phones To Stream Netanyahu's UN Speech
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Friday said that his country "must finish the job" against Hamas in Gaza. In a defiant speech at the United Nations General Assembly, he expressed his refusal to end the war with Gaza.

title: Sonam Wangchuk Arrested Under Stringent NSA, Taken To Jodhpur: Sources
content: Ladakh statehood activist Sonam Wangchuk, who faces allegations of inciting a mob with provocative statements, has been arrested a day after he said he would be "happy to be arrested anytime for this cause".

title: Tamil Nadu Minister On Difference Between Being A Woman In North, South
content: Uttar Pradesh 'lives' by way of money paid as tax contribution by Tamil Nadu to the Centre and this is the truth, Tamil Nadu Industries Minister TRB Rajaa has claimed.

title: NISAR satellite sends first radar images of Earth’s surface
content: The images display details with which NISAR scans Earth to provide unique, actionable information to decision-makers in a diverse range of areas

title: BPF leads in Assam’s Bodoland council polls
content: The party was leading in 21 of the autonomous council’s 40 seats, more than 12 hours after the counting of votes began at 8 a.m. on Friday. The UPPL and ally-turned-rival BJP are set to win almost as many seats as in the 2020 polls.

title: Congress slams detention of Ladakh activist Sonam Wangchuk, demands judicial probe into violence that left four youth dead
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh says detention was meant to divert attention from BJP’s failure to ensure security, Sixth Schedule status in Ladakh; Congress Ladakh chief slams “police firing” against protestors

title: Women’s ODI World Cup: Opening ceremony toned down for Zubeen Garg’s death
content: BCCI is consciously moving marquee cricket matches out of tier 1 cities to attract more girls to cricket, Secretary Devajit Saikia says

title: Science Ministry survey on research and development in India gets weak response from private sector
content: The latest edition of the survey was launched in December 2024 with firms given time until September 30, 2025 to submit responses; the deadline may be extended now

title: AAP attacks BJP over Sonam Wangchuk’s detention
content: Drawing parallels to Ravana, Hitler, and Mussolini, AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal responds to activist’s detention by warning of the downfall of “those who practice dictatorship and arrogance”

title: Bareilly tense as police personnel and protesters clash over poster row
content: The protest was against the police FIR against people who carried ‘I Love Muhammed’ posters at a Kanpur procession on September 4

title: Tile-by-tile restoration brings back the lost splendour of Paigah Tombs in Hyderabad
content: After decades of neglect, destruction, and encroachment, the tombs are now being restored by the State government and the Aga Khan Trust for Culture, with funding from the U.S. State Department’s Ambassadors Fund for Cultural Preservation

title: QuantM: A game-changer for milk safety and farmer livelihoods
content: What makes the innovation even more powerful is its integration with NIAB’s rapid antimicrobial sensitivity kit, as a result the two tests can confirm both the presence of mastitis and the most effective treatment within two hours — a process that typically takes two to three days in conventional labs

title: Environmentalists, former Minister appeal Supreme Court to restrain Himalayan road building
content: Environmentalists have argued that cutting hill slopes and the resulting debris are damaging to the eco-system and worsen the impact of landslides and torrential rains as well as cause massive roadblocks and pile-up on these mountain roads.

title: India says NATO chief’s remarks on Modi-Putin talks ‘entirely baseless’
content: Speculative or careless remarks that misrepresent the Prime Minister’s engagements are unacceptable, says MEA Spokesperson

title: Thadou, Meitei leaders seek disqualification of BJP MLA Paolienlal Haokip
content: Question his Indian citizenship, accuse him of ‘engineering’ the conflict because State govt. wanted to remove Any Kuki Tribe from Manipur’s ST list

title: Supreme Court issues notice on pleas seeking transparency in NEET-PG exam evaluation process
content: The top court, however, questioned why there were only 20 aggrieved candidates from among the two lakh who appeared for the examination

title: Tangedco Junior Engineer, four other staff suspended
content: Initial inquiry revealed that the deceased gangman K. Prabhakaran (40) was roped in to install four electrical poles on a new plot in Vilankuppam village on September 23.

title: ‘Students should blend science and ethics to become global citizens’
content: Delivering his inaugural address at the 16th edition of graVITas, Mr. Mansoori said that students should be creative and compassionate thinkers to achieve a balance between progress and sustainability in their career.

title: Vellore Corporation to focus on UGD work, community dogs sterilization, road re-lay: Mayor
content: Most of the councillors highlighted the need to conduct monthly council meetings as against the existing practice of once in three or four months as such an arrangement will allow them to air public grievances regularly.

title: Union Minister Amit Shah visits poll-bound Bihar for two days
content: Amit Shah is on a two-day visit to Bihar to mull over poll preparedness and seat distribution among NDA allies for the upcoming Assembly election

title: Calcutta HC directs repatriation of six West Bengal residents pushed into Bangladesh
content: “Not following such procedure and acting in hot haste to deport them is a clear violation which renders the deportation order bad in law and liable to be set aside,” the Bench noted.

title: Veritas Sainik School in Tirupati added for spot counselling
content: It is aimed at providing candidates a wider choice of schools, says a circular from the Sainik Schools Society

title: Govt readying vision to make Telangana aerospace capital: Minister Sridhar Babu
content: Phase-2 of Aerospace and Defence Cluster, dedicated Aerospace MSME Park on the cards, special task force to expedite approvals proposed

title: Gauhati HC grants bail to Kuki Inpi spokesperson in NIA case on killing of Manipur commandos
content: Court questions NIA over filing two FIRs for same incident; notes improbability of Kuki planning attack with Meitei suspect

title: In 2019, three Ministries gave nod to Ladakh’s tribal status
content: Ministries of Home, Tribal Affairs, and Law, and NCST concurred on Sixth Schedule; but in 2022, Home Ministry said UT administration was ensuring “development” that tribal status would bring

title: BJP demands White Paper on cooperative bank scam
content: BJP national executive committee member P.K. Krishnadas says LDF government has ruined the cooperative sector in the past 10 years

title: Take ₹10,000 from NDA govt. but don’t vote for them, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra tells Bihar women
content: Targeting the ruling BJP-JD(U), the Congress leader asks why they didn’t think of women’s welfare for all these 20 years they have been in power. When the BJP failed in seeking votes in the name of caste, religion, infiltration and hollow speeches, it started new tactics of vote chori (vote theft), she says.

title: Lokesh announces setting up of international law university, probe panel on SKU irregularities
content: The university to come up in Amaravati will begin admissions in the 2025-26 academic year, with 20% seats reserved for local students, says Education Minister in Andhra Pradesh Assembly

title: Category league mock draft: Jokic or Wemby at No. 1?
content: Our 10-team, H2H category league mock draft included familiar faces a the top and Amen Thompson, Cade Cunningham and Tyrese Maxey all going in the top 25.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Battle for No. 1: Draisaitl, Pastrnak and the players to consider
content: Six players have a chance at being the No. 1 pick in fantasy hockey drafts, and we look at each one is deserving.

title: Enforcement Directorate grills Bengal minister for second consecutive day in teachers’ recruitment scam
content: A special court in Kolkata on September 24, 2025, had rejected the central agency's plea for Chandranath Sinha's custody in this connection with their investigation of the matter

title: AFSPA extended in parts of Manipur, Arunachal and Nagaland for another six months
content: In Manipur, AFSPA has been extended in the whole State, except in jurisdictions of 13 police stations in five valley districts

title: Astronauts with diabetes can undertake space missions, says study conducted during Axiom-4 mission
content: Results concluded that everyday diabetes tools used by millions on Earth can be used comprehensively to provide end-to-end diabetes monitoring from space to the ground and back to space

title: Telangana government provides 42% quota for BCs in local bodies
content: Order issued providing quota in seats and positions in local bodies to BC communities; The order has been issued based on the evidence, legal sanction and judicial recognition and in view of the urgent necessity to ensure welfare, empowerment and full participation of backward classes, says BC Welfare Secretary

title: Congress inaugurates Manmohan Singh library at party headquarters
content: Facility with 1,200 books opened on former Prime Minister’s 93rd birth anniversary; family members and senior leaders present

title: Union ministry’s award for SCTIMST scientist
content: R.S. Jayasree selected for the Women in Medicine Award by the National Academy of Medical Sciences under the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

title: Lawyers urged not to represent accused in Zubeen Garg death case
content: The CID of Assam Police issued notices to people who were linked to or aware of the events leading to the iconic singer’s death to appear within 10 days

title: A.P. will emerge as national logistics hub, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: CM announces in the Assembly that 14,966 km of roads will be developed at a cost of ₹4,500 crore, while national highway projects worth ₹1.5 lakh crore are already under way, placing A.P. second in the country for highway density

title: Chief Secretary directs swift action on disease outbreaks and flood preparedness
content: Vijayanand instructs District Collectors to contain diarrhoea and gastroenteritis cases, repair drinking water pipelines, set up medical camps, and stay alert as Godavari and Krishna rivers swell amid heavy rainfall forecasts.

title: BMTC’s NICE Road service emerges top performer: Nearly 38 lakh passengers carried, ₹17.13 crore earned in revenue
content: The service, popularly known as NICE-10, connects Madavara on Tumakuru Road with Electronics City by making use of the NICE Road that links Tumakuru Road with Hosur Road

title: Thrissur’s ‘Meet Your Collector’ reaches 50th episode
content: Interactive platform connects students and other citizens with governance.  On September 27, the 50th edition will be held at Muniyattukunnu Hill Station in Varandarappilly

title: Survey picks up even as State govt. says participation is not mandatory
content: Teachers who abstained from data collection return to survey duty in Belagavi and Bagalkot districts

title: CPI(M) says SIR will disenfranchise an estimated 50 lakh voters in Kerala
content: State secretary M.V. Govindan says ECI’s decision to use the 2002 electoral rolls as a point of reference for preparing the latest voters’ list was fundamentally flawed. In the past 23 years, Kerala population has increased by nearly 1.57 crore. The number of polling booths in the State has increased by 10,000

title: Devotee rush swells at Kanaka Durga temple on fifth day of Dasara
content: Over 90,000 devotees visit the hill shrine; Kanipakam temple presents silk offerings, former Minister Satyanarayana laments the decline in festive grandeur, and Governor Abdul Nazeer participates in rituals

title: Revised fuel-efficiency norms offer relief for small cars
content: Changes to the 2024 draft follows criticism from heavyweight Maruti Suzuki, leading to a pushback from SUV-maker like Mahindra

title: Drinking water schemes for Guntur, West Godavari in the pipeline, says Minister Narayana
content: Large-scale allocations being made for improving social welfare hostel infrastructure across the State, Social Welfare Minister Dola Sri Bala Veeranjaneyaswamy informs the Andhra Pradesh Assembly

title: Govt. decision to end HMR-PPP irresponsible, hasty: KTR
content: BRS working president says it would add ₹15K crore burden more on people in addition to ₹2.2L crore debt made by Congress govt. in last 22 months

title: Fishing folk release back into sea accidental catch of protected Widenose Guitarfish
content: Researchers from the Central Marine Fisheries Research Institute have recorded two instances of such capture of Widenose Guitarfish

title: Tejashwi Yadav, aide Sanjay Yadav break silence over Rohini Acharya’s cryptic post
content: The Leader of Opposition in Bihar Assembly says her elder sister, who donated her kidney to RJD chief Lalu Prasad, never had any desire to contest elections and did not want a ticket for anyone else

title: Private firm blacklisted for non-payment of EPF to outsourced employees of BRT Tiger Reserve
content: The firm, RC Business Solutions in Mysuru, has not only been barred from participating in government tenders for a period of two years, its EMD and security deposits submitted at the time of participating in the tender have been forfeited

title: Tirumala Brahmotsavams: Lord Malayappa on ‘Simha Vahanam’ steals the show
content: The Lord, seated on the chariot in a meditative posture and adorned with rare and precious jewels, is the cynosure of all eyes

title: Meet tracks progress of city gas work, flags threats
content: The ‘Dial before you dig’ initiative, which urges departments to contact a helpline before undertaking excavation, presented at meet.

title: Social and Educational Survey 2025: DC suspends officer for dereliction of duty
content: Mr. Ranganath, the nodal officer of Hosanagar taluk, had the responsibility of appointing enumerators for the shadow area, where there was no network connection. However, he went on leave without taking permission from senior officers and did not respond to phone calls

title: CWRDM expresses readiness to test water samples for amoeba causing meningoencephalitis
content: Centre has the necessary equipment to conduct RT-PCR test and the qualified personnel to do the tests

title: 'Unwarranted': India pulls up Turkey's Erdogan over UN speech; what triggered row?
content: India strongly rejected Turkish President Erdogan's "objectionable" remarks on Jammu and Kashmir at the UNGA, reiterating it's a strictly bilateral issue with Pakistan requiring no third-party mediation. New Delhi lodged a strong protest, emphasizing that such statements on India's territorial integrity are unacceptable. India also highlighted Pakistan's cross-border terrorism as the root cause of the problem.

title: NDA's DBT 'Brahmastra': Rs 10k for 75 lakh women - Will it be a game changer in Bihar polls?
content: The Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government launched a Rs 7,500-crore DBT scheme, transferring Rs 10,000 to 75 lakh women for empowerment. PM Modi used the virtual launch to attack the RJD, urging women to ensure NDA's return. This election-eve initiative, similar to successful schemes elsewhere, faces opposition criticism as a voter bribe.

title: LG announces reopening of 12 tourist destinations in J&K closed after Pahlagam attack
content: Jammu and Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha reopened 12 tourist destinations after a crucial security review meeting, asserting that the war against terrorism is not over. He directed forces to remain on high alert and continue stringent action against the terror ecosystem. These sites, closed following an April 22 attack, will reopen from September 29.

title: Accenture fired 11,000+ employees; CEO Julie Sweet warns, exit or upgrade
content: Accenture laid off over 11,000 employees globally in three months, citing rapid AI adoption and slowing corporate demand. These cuts are part of an $865 million restructuring, with more exits anticipated as the company aligns its workforce with AI-driven solutions and invests in agentic AI training. Despite the layoffs, Accenture reported a 7% revenue increase.

title: Israel hijacks phones of Gazans: Netanyahu 'speaks' to hostages from UN; sends strong msg
content: The Israeli army seized Gaza residents' mobile phones to broadcast Prime Minister Netanyahu's UN speech live, an operation he announced during his address. Netanyahu directly addressed hostages and warned Hamas leaders to release them, stating his message was streamed via Gaza cell phones and loudspeakers placed inside the Strip as part of a public diplomacy effort.

title: ‘Curb Russia oil imports’: US tells India - Crude buy key factor in reducing tariffs
content: US trade negotiators reportedly linked a trade deal and tariff reduction to India curbing Russian oil imports, following increased US tariffs on Indian goods. India, maintaining its stance on Russian purchases, proposed importing Iranian and Venezuelan oil as an alternative.

title: Silicon Valley Billionaire warns: H-1B policy may backfire; Indian engineers at risk
content: Michael Moritz, a prominent Silicon Valley investor, has strongly condemned President Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee, arguing it will stifle innovation and drive talent overseas. He believes the policy reflects a misunderstanding of the factors driving American tech success. Moritz suggests expanding the H-1B program and offering citizenship to STEM PhD graduates instead.

title: Stephen & Ayesha Curry mark Daughters Day, Ayesha promotes skincare line
content: Ayesha Curry, balancing her Sweet July Skin line and motherhood, celebrated Daughter's Day with Riley and Ryan, promoting her lip product. Her 13-year-old daughter, Riley, models for the brand and pursues volleyball. Ayesha instills discipline in her children, even paying them for chores, as the family recently welcomed baby Cai.

title: Canada sees 50% drop in Indian study permits, $10.5B impact expected
content: Canada has seen a 50% decline in Indian study permit approvals in 2025, with projections suggesting a 67.5% drop from 2023. The number of new student arrivals and total permit holders has also decreased sharply. According to ICEF Monitor, this trend stems from stricter immigration policies, economic pressures, and rising global competition. The downturn could lead to a $10.5 billion shortfall in economic contributions, severely affecting Canadian education institutions and provincial economies.

title: Trump's 100% pharma tariffs: How bad will India's exports be hit?
content: Donald Trump announced 100% tariffs on imported branded or patented pharmaceutical products from October 1, 2025, unless companies build US manufacturing facilities. This policy primarily impacts European nations exporting high-value drugs, while India's generic exports may largely be shielded, though "branded generics" classification remains a concern.

title: AWS CEO 'warns' Staff: Deliver products faster; Losing AI battle
content: Amazon Web Services CEO Matt Garman has urged his staff to expedite product rollouts, particularly in AI, ahead of the Reinvent conference. This comes amid growing concerns that AWS is falling behind in the AI race, despite CEO Andy Jassy's defense of their position. Garman showcased 'Quick,' a new AI agent designed to automate tasks, signaling a strategic shift.

title: Asia Cup: New Record! Abhishek surpasses Kohli, Rizwan to achieve this rare feat
content: Abhishek Sharma sets a new T20 Asia Cup record. He is now the highest run-scorer in a single edition. Sharma scored 309 runs in six innings. This surpasses Mohammad Rizwan and Virat Kohli's previous totals. His batting impact is vital for India. India plays Sri Lanka in a Super Fours match. India and Pakistan are already in the final.

title: $100k fees for H-1B: India assures continued talks with US
content: India is engaging the US administration regarding proposed H-1B visa fee increases. These new rules could impact many Indian citizens. The MEA stresses the benefits of skilled workforce mobility for both nations. Discussions also address recent US tariffs on Indian goods. India's government departments are examining the tariff situation. Bilateral trade agreement talks continue.

title: 'Man of peace': Pak PM turns Trump's trumpet at UN; parrots claims
content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shahbaz Sharif, in his UNGA speech, lauded Donald Trump for his "active role" in brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan after military action in May. Sharif nominated Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize, calling him "a man of peace" for his contributions, despite India's denial of any foreign influence in their operations.

title: 'They didn’t want a Black character': Gabrielle Union on being rejected from movie
content: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, recently spoke about facing discrimination in Hollywood. She revealed being rejected for a role due to her ethnicity. Union wanted to be in 'Sugar and Spice' but was turned down. She also discussed beauty standards and how they affected her career. Despite challenges, Union has achieved success. Her marriage with Wade inspires many.

title: Report: Taylor Swift overwhelmed planning Kelce wedding amid security
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, engaged after dating since 2023, are actively planning their wedding. Swift is enjoying researching venues and considering numerous offers from major designers to create her wedding gown, feeling overwhelmed by the response. Concerns arise regarding Swift's security, highlighted by her increased safety measures and absences from recent Chiefs' games.

title: Lauren Kyle, Celeste Desjardins enjoy girls’ night at favorite spot
content: Lauren Kyle, wife of Connor McDavid, enjoyed a girls' night out with Celeste Desjardins at her restaurant, Bar Trove, showcasing her fall fashion. Beyond nightlife, Kyle hosted a charity poker tournament supporting the Oilers Foundation's initiative to help children access youth sports. She balances style, social influence, and philanthropy, establishing herself as a prominent figure in Edmonton.

title: Asia Cup: ICC punishes Rauf for 'aggressive gestures', warns Farhan; SKY fined
content: Suryakumar Yadav and Haris Rauf each received a 30% match fee fine from the ICC for their on-field conduct during the Asia Cup India vs Pakistan matches. Rauf was penalised for aggressive gestures towards fans, while Yadav was fined for expressing solidarity with terror victims. Sahibzada Farhan also received a warning for his celebration.

title: Algo diplomacy: How Xi used TikTok to court Trump - robbery or 'win-win'?
content: President Trump endorsed a $14 billion deal to spin off TikTok's US operations, fulfilling a 2024 divestment law. This strategic move by China aims to reset US-China ties, potentially trading TikTok for tariff relief and diplomatic breathing room. Trump hails it as a political victory, while the deal reshapes tech diplomacy and global power dynamics.

title: 'IND-PAK competition no longer exists': Hockey star Hardik goes bold - Watch
content: Hardik Singh, Indian hockey vice-captain, recently mimicked Haris Rauf's plane-crash gesture. He discussed Pakistan's hockey performance against India. Hardik stated Pakistan has not won against India since 2014. He expressed contentment with his hockey career choice. India allows matches in multi-nation tournaments. Pakistan declined to take part in the Asia Cup in India.

title: Delhi: AAP leader dons mosquito net to sting BJP on dengue cases - watch
content: AAP leaders protested at the MCD, wearing mosquito repellent nets, to highlight the alarming rise in malaria, chikungunya, and dengue cases in Delhi. AAP LoP Ankush Narang criticized the ruling BJP for its lack of strategy, citing a report showing 333 malaria cases, the highest in five years, and increasing dengue.

title: Palestine to join Brics? Envoy submits application - what China said
content: Palestine has formally applied to join the BRICS bloc, confirmed by its ambassador to Russia, Abdel Hafiz Nofal. This move comes as several Western nations, including Canada, Australia, Portugal, and the UK, recently recognized Palestinian statehood. China, a key BRICS member, has expressed openness to welcoming more "like-minded partners" into the expanding group of emerging economies.

title: Air India crash: SC hears plea for independent investigation into June 12 disaster
content: The Supreme Court is hearing a plea for a court-monitored investigation into the June 12 Air India crash that killed 260 people. The petition challenges the official report blaming pilots, citing inconsistencies and suggesting Boeing's potential design flaws are being overlooked to evade liability. The court also criticized selective leaks of the preliminary report, tagging this plea with a similar pending case.

title: 'Why we fight': QR code on Netanyahu's lapel - what did it link to?
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addressed the UN, displaying a QR code of Hamas atrocities and directly speaking to hostages. He demanded Hamas release captives and accept Israel's terms for Gaza's future, asserting Israel "must finish the job" against Hamas despite global pressure, as delegates walked out during his speech.

title: Why Trump is unlikely to win the Nobel Peace Prize
content: Trump is obsessed with the Peace Prize.  He mentions it at rallies, he hounds his allies, he discusses it with enemies, he literally demands world leaders nominate him for it and even threatens Norway with tariffs if Oslo doesn’t give him one. Take this year’s UN General Assembly, where Trump, while complaining about escalators and teleprompters, claimed he had “stopped seven wars” — Israel–Iran, India–Pakistan, Armenia–Azerbaijan, Congo–Rwanda, Serbia–Kosovo, Egypt–Ethiopia, and even Thailand–Cambodia.

title: 'Don’t think they’ll even manage that': Bachchan trolls Pakistan, Akhtar
content: Abhishek Bachchan humorously reacted after Shoaib Akhtar mistakenly referred to cricketer Abhishek Sharma as the actor during a live show discussing the India-Pakistan Asia Cup final. Akhtar's on-air blooper left panellists in splits, prompting Bachchan's witty reply on X, stating even he couldn't get out. This viral moment blended cricket and Bollywood ahead of the highly anticipated final.

title: Donald Trump throws kitchen sink at big pharma with targeted tariffs
content: Donald Trump imposed a 100% tariff on patented drugs unless manufactured in the US, effective October 2025. India's generic pharma exports remain largely unaffected, and major Indian branded drug exporters already have US plants. However, India's $66 billion pharmaceutical industry is closely monitoring potential future tariffs on generics.

title: New COVID virus strain spikes in US: Know all symptoms
content: A new COVID-19 variant, Stratus, is now spreading globally. This variant, first detected in Southeast Asia, is currently predominant in several US states. Stratus evades the immune system better than the previous Nimbus strain. It causes typical COVID-19 symptoms, though often mild for vaccinated individuals. Health experts advise precautions like masking and hand washing to prevent its spread. Read below!

title: Netanyahu speaks at UN: Many delegations walk out - what Israel PM said
content: Benjamin Netanyahu maintained his defiant stance on continuing military action in Gaza at the UN General Assembly, despite increasing international isolation and a significant delegate walkout. He condemned nations recognizing Palestinian statehood and broadcasted his demands to Gaza residents, linking peace to hostage return and Hamas's disarmament, while facing mounting global pressure and war crimes allegations.

title: Kendrick Perkins's grandmother passes away at 90
content: NBA analyst Kendrick Perkins is deeply saddened by the passing of his 90-year-old grandmother, Mary Lewis, who raised him after his mother's early death. She was his unwavering support through his entire life and career. Perkins, who lost his grandfather at 29, shared an emotional tribute on Instagram, highlighting her profound impact and unconditional love.

title: UK toddler murder: Indian-origin duo charged with killing 3-year-old
content: Metropolitan Police have charged Indian-origin individuals, Manpreet Jatana (34) and Jaskiret Singh Uppal (36), with the murder of 3-year-old Penelope Chandrie. The toddler was found deceased at a Hayes residence on December 17, 2023. Following a nearly two-year investigation, the pair were arrested and charged this week, appearing in Uxbridge Magistrates' Court. The case now proceeds through criminal court.

title: Asia Cup: India vs Sri Lanka; why is Jasprit Bumrah not playing against Sri Lanka?
content: India made two changes for their final Super Fours fixture against Sri Lanka, resting pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah and all-rounder Shivam Dube, with Arshdeep Singh and Harshit Rana drafted in. This match holds no significance in terms of qualification for India, who have already secured their spot in the Asia Cup final against Pakistan. Skipper Suryakumar Yadav emphasized the need for fielding improvements.

title: 'I Love Muhammad' row: Protesters pelt stones; cops lathicharge in Bareilly
content: In Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh, police used lathi charge against Muslim protesters who engaged in stone pelting after Friday prayers. The demonstration, organized by cleric Maulana Tauqeer Raza over "I Love Muhammad" poster controversy, saw authorities conducting a flag march and deploying heavy security to maintain order. The cleric warned that the protest would proceed regardless of permission.

title: Sonam Wangchuk arrested: Activist moved out of Ladakh; internet suspended
content: Leh Police arrested activist Sonam Wangchuk following the cancellation of his NGO's license amidst escalating tensions in Ladakh. Protests demanding statehood and Sixth Schedule safeguards turned violent, resulting in casualties and widespread unrest. Wangchuk, who was on a hunger strike, called it off after fellow protesters were hospitalized, triggering further demonstrations and clashes with security forces.

title: 'One India': Canada gets clear message from Delhi; Khalistan threat in focus
content: Canada and India are working to mend strained relations, focusing on mutual security concerns like terrorism and transnational crime. Nathalie Drouin's recent visit to India and meeting with Ajit Doval signal a renewed commitment to bilateral dialogue.

title: Dwyane Wade's 3 words message for his wife Gabrielle Union
content: Dwyane Wade celebrated Gabrielle Union's Variety Entrepreneur Impact Award, posting a 3-word Instagram message praising her "leading lady energy." He also revealed his attraction to her intelligence, which he discovered after being initially mesmerized by her beauty. The couple continues to be a strong and supportive unit.

title: Harjit Kaur deportation: India responds to return of Sikh grandma
content: The MEA reported that over 2,400 Indian nationals have been deported from the US since January 2025, emphasizing India's stance against illegal migration while promoting legal pathways. Among those deported was Harjit Kaur, a 73-year-old woman who had resided in the US for over 30 years. Her case garnered significant attention due to the circumstances of her arrest and deportation, which she described as harrowing.

title: IND-PAK row reaches women's WC! Harmanpreet Kaur says 'we don't talk about it'
content: Harmanpreet Kaur is set to lead India in the ICC Women’s ODI World Cup at home, emphasizing enjoyment over pressure. The team is focused on cricket, especially in the context of the anticipated match against Pakistan. Alyssa Healy acknowledges India's strength in home conditions, while other captains share their strategies and expectations for the tournament.

title: IND vs PAK: 'If we get Abhishek Bachchan out early' - Akhtar's remark goes viral
content: During a cricket talk show, Shoaib Akhtar's humorous slip of the tongue, mistaking cricketer Abhishek Sharma for Bollywood actor Abhishek Bachchan, went viral. This blooper occurred while discussing Pakistan's chances against India in the Asia Cup final, adding a lighthearted moment amidst the high-pressure atmosphere. The incident highlights the deep connection between Bollywood and cricket in South Asian culture.

title: 'Examining impact': India's first response to 100% pharma tariffs by US
content: India is closely monitoring the potential impact of the US's proposed tariffs of up to 100% on imported branded and patented pharmaceutical drugs, set to begin October 1. The relevant ministries are examining the matter, recognizing the US as India's largest pharma export market, accounting for approximately $10 billion in FY25.

title: IND-PAK final: Akhtar turns astrologer; calls it a 'bad day for India'
content: Shoaib Akhtar predicts India's downfall in the Asia Cup final against Pakistan, emphasizing the need for Pakistan to maintain their hunger from the Super Fours win. He believes Pakistan's bowling attack, especially with a strong pace attack, can trouble India if they set a good target. He also said that a "bad day" is coming for them and it has to be on Sunday.
